title: Apple Gift Card Product Marketing
description:
At Apple, we donʼt just build great products \- we create a kind of wonder that revolutionizes entire industries. Itʼs the diversity of our people and their ideas driving the innovation in everything we do, from amazing technology to industry\-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it.  

  

The Apple Wallet, Payments, and Commerce team is growing, adding new features to our products, and connecting to Apple users and shoppers around the world. Weʼre looking for a Consumer Marketing Manager to deliver world\-class marketing initiatives for Apple Gift Card and Apple Account. You will showcase these products through paid media, email marketing, on\-device messaging, our creator footprint, and other marketing channels.  

  

**Description**  

  

You will drive awareness and engagement for Apple Gift Card and Apple Account through our consumer marketing campaigns in over 40 countries. You will be the marketer orchestrating an array of marketing disciplines to ensure that gift shoppers and Apple users around the world understand everything about these offerings.  

  

","responsibilities":"Leading seasonal paid media campaigns and supporting promotions from brief to reporting.  

  

Brief and develop consumer initiatives to foster consideration and adoption, using consumer research and data insights to inform strategies and execution.  

  

Connect with cross\-functional teams within the Services organization to assemble and execute initiatives that showcases Apple Gift Card and Apple Account within the context of Apple as a brand.  

  

Manage agency and vendor relationships to execute global and local campaigns, tracking deliverables and timelines.  

  

Engage and collaborate with multi\-market teams to accelerate campaign adoption and integrate local efforts into global strategies for new markets. This role requires the candidate to be available to work non\-standard PT work hours to meet with teammates in Japan and China (5% of the week).  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

  

Familiarity with AI tools and openness to exploring how technology can improve our processes.  

  

Experience managing tasks and deliverables within platforms such as AirTable and Wrike.  

  

Demonstrated experience negotiating the use of third\-party intellectual properties in campaigns in partnership with studios, music labels, and business affairs teams.  

  

Enthusiasm for Apple products and services.  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

  

8\+ years of experience managing integrated advertising programs within a marketing function.  

  

5\+ years of experience delivering global, complex communication projects autonomously and successfully.  

  

3\+ years of experience managing and tracking budgets, vendor payments, and deadlines with minimal supervision.  

  

Demonstrated success working cross\-functionally with internal and external partners, cultivating interpersonal relationships.  

  

Strong organization skills and behaviors to manage global, complex projects with precision.  

  

Strong attention to detail in creative execution, copywriting, campaign development, and specs management.  

  

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  

  

B.A. or B.S. degree  

  

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

title: Senior Data Scientist, Account & Data Security
description:
Would you like to drive the future of Apple's products, applications, and platform while having the unique opportunity to impact some of the most far\-reaching software in the world? The Apple Services Engineering (ASE) organization leads the development and innovation on Apple's cloud\-centric products and experiences for users all over the world, including iCloud\+, Photos, Mail, Messages, FaceTime, Calendar, Notes, etc. We are the foundation on which Apple's software developers build the products that our customers love. Our multi\-disciplinary data team plays a fundamental role in this mission by partnering closely with product, engineering, and business teams to develop a culture of leveraging data to inform and craft our strategy.  

  

**Description**  

  

We are looking for someone with a track record in identifying, executing, distilling and communicating technical projects to senior leadership, leading to better, more data\-informed decision making.  

  

This role partners closely with business and product teams across ASE, focusing specifically on Account \& Data Security initiatives that protect Apple's customers and their most sensitive data.  

  

Work includes:  

  

* Lead security initiatives across engineering organizations by partnering with engineering teams to implement data\-driven security improvements that span the entire Apple ecosystem.

  

* Optimize critical user journeys by analyzing and improving account creation, authentication, and recovery flows that handle millions of daily interactions while maintaining Apple's security standards.

  

* Enhance fraud detection capabilities by developing sophisticated models to identify and prevent account takeovers, fraudulent purchases, and abuse patterns across Apple's services ecosystem.

  

* Strengthen data protection measures using analytics to optimize encryption implementations, secure data transmission, and privacy\-preserving technologies.

  

* Build scalable security analytics platforms by partnering with Data Engineering to design and implement data pipelines that process security events and user behavior patterns at Apple's scale.

  

* Influence product roadmaps through data storytelling by presenting compelling analyses to executive leadership that shape multi\-quarter security and privacy feature development.

  

* Plan, design, and analyze A/B tests for security features to optimize security measures without compromising user experience.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

  

Your academic background is in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Physics, and etc. Advanced degree preferred.  

  

Security specialization with experience in threat modeling, vulnerability assessment, or security operations in large\-scale consumer platforms.  

  

Privacy expertise including knowledge of differential privacy, secure multi\-party computation, or other privacy\-preserving technologies.  

  

Regulatory experience with familiarity with global privacy regulations e.g. GDPR.  

  

Cross\-functional leadership with history of leading matrix organizations or influencing teams without direct authority.  

  

Experience leveraging AI to automate, scale and accelerate work streams.  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

  

8\+ years in a data analytics or data science role (6\+ years in a data science role).  

  

Proven track record of cross\-functional influence with experience leading initiatives that span multiple engineering teams and business functions.  

  

Executive communication expertise with demonstrated ability to present technical security concepts to C\-level executives and influence strategic decisions.  

  

Security domain knowledge including deep understanding of authentication systems, encryption, fraud detection, and privacy\-preserving technologies.  

  

Advanced technical skills with expert\-level SQL and programming proficiency (Python, R, Scala) with experience in distributed computing (Spark, Hive).  

  

Statistical and ML expertise with strong foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimental design for security applications.  

  

Stakeholder management experience building consensus among diverse technical and business stakeholders with competing priorities.  

  

High tolerance for ambiguity with ability to navigate complex, evolving security landscape and drive clarity from incomplete information.  

  

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

title: AR/VR Software Development Engineer, Vision Products Software
description:
Shape the future of spatial computing by building revolutionary UI rendering technologies for Apple Vision Pro and next\-generation vision products. As part of the RealityKit team, you'll architect and optimize the foundational rendering systems that bring spatial interfaces to life\-transforming how millions interact with applications in visionOS.  

  

Push the boundaries of real\-time UI rendering to deliver fluid, responsive spatial experiences. You'll develop high\-performance rendering pipelines that seamlessly blend 2D interface elements with 3D spatial content, optimize GPU workloads for crystal\-clear text and graphics, and pioneer new techniques for rendering adaptive, context\-aware user interfaces in mixed reality. Your work will directly impact how users interact with every application across Apple's vision ecosystem.  

  

Join a world\-class team defining the next era of human\-computer interaction. Every optimization you craft, every rendering technique you innovate, and every pixel you perfect will empower developers and delight users worldwide. This is your opportunity to work at the intersection of graphics, user interface design, and spatial computing\-building technology that doesn't just render interfaces, but creates intuitive, immersive interactions.  

  

**Description**  

  

As a Spatial UI Rendering Engineer on the RealityKit team, you'll architect and implement the core rendering systems that power user interfaces across visionOS and spatial computing products. You'll develop cutting\-edge GPU pipelines that render crisp text, smooth animations, and beautiful interface elements in 3D space, optimize real\-time rendering with advanced techniques to ensure responsive interactions, and collaborate closely with framework teams, Metal engineers, and designers to deliver exceptional visual quality and performance. Your work will span the full rendering stack\-from low\-level shader optimization and efficient compositing to high\-level API design\-ensuring developers have powerful, intuitive tools to create stunning spatial interfaces. You'll tackle complex challenges like efficient multi\-layer rendering, seamless integration of 2D and 3D content, and adaptive rendering for varying viewing distances, all while maintaining Apple's uncompromising standards for performance, visual fidelity, and user experience.","responsibilities":"Design and implement high\-performance rendering systems for spatial user interfaces in RealityKit.  

  

Optimize GPU shaders and rendering algorithms to achieve exceptional visual quality, smooth animations, and consistent frame rates on Apple silicon.  

  

Build intuitive APIs that enable developers to create responsive, beautiful interfaces for visionOS applications.  

  

Profile and debug complex rendering issues across the graphics stack using Instruments and GPU debugging tools.  

  

Collaborate with framework teams to integrate UI rendering capabilities with existing Apple technologies.  

  

Prototype innovative rendering features for future vision products and evaluate emerging graphics technologies.  

  

Write comprehensive unit tests and performance benchmarks to ensure rendering quality and stability across diverse content.  

  

Conduct code reviews and contribute to technical specifications that maintain exceptional engineering standards.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

  

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Graphics, or related field  

  

7\+ years of experience shipping UI rendering features in high\-profile consumer products.  

  

Deep familiarity with Apple's 2D graphics frameworks such as Core Graphics, Core Animation, or UIKit.  

  

Experience developing rendering systems for user interfaces with text rendering, vector graphics, and compositing.  

  

Expert knowledge of GPU\-accelerated UI rendering, including efficient batching and draw call optimization.  

  

Proven track record optimizing rendering performance for Apple silicon and GPU architectures  

  

Experience with spatial computing, AR/VR rendering, or multi\-view display systems.  

  

Familiarity with accessibility features and rendering techniques that support diverse user needs.  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

  

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.  

  

5\+ years of professional experience working on 2D and/or 3D real\-time rendering applications.  

  

High proficiency in writing safe, performant C\+\+ code.  

  

Knowledge of the graphics pipeline, modern rendering techniques, and image processing.  

  

Experience with modern graphics APIs (Metal, Vulkan, Direct3D 12, WebGPU) and shading languages (MSL, HLSL, GLSL, WGSL).  

  

Experience with all stages of software development, from prototyping to performance optimization.  

  

Strong problem\-solving skills and ability to debug complex rendering issues.  

  

Outstanding teamwork and communication skills.  

  

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

company_description: This is where you can do the best work of your life.

title: Creative Assistant, Apple TV
description:
**Summary**
 This position will provide support for a 2 creative executives at Apple TV. The successful candidate will be a collaborative team member with a friendly demeanor and determined work ethic. We need someone exceptionally well\-organized and able to effectively multi\-task \& prioritize, taking initiative and budgeting time for special projects.
   

  

**Description**
 Ability to run cross\-functional calendars with heavy calendaring, while supporting the overall teams
   

  

 Coordinate meetings via live, videoconference and conference calls
   

  

 Help plan and execute offsite meetings for the team
   

  

 Consistent interaction with top Executive Admins and Executives within Apple Inc.
   

  

 Handle and maintain highly confidential and sensitive information
   

  

 Ability to excel working with complex and different personalities diplomatically
   

  

 Proficient in eApproval and complete expense reports
   

  

 Efficient in Apple programs, especially iCal, Keynote, Numbers, Pages along with additional knowledge of Excel
   

  

 Contribute a fun and creative approach to team activities and morale
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Provide comprehensive administrative support to Creative Development Executives, including complex calendaring, meeting coordination, call scheduling, and travel arrangements.
* Prepare meeting agendas, take detailed notes, and track follow\-ups to ensure efficient workflow.
* Process and track expense reports and other administrative documentation in a timely manner.
* Assist in the creative evaluation process by reviewing scripts, drafting coverage, and compiling feedback.
* Maintain databases and development grids, ensuring accurate tracking of project status, submissions, and talent outreach.
* Coordinate communication between internal departments, production partners, and external creative teams with discretion and professionalism.
* Handle highly sensitive and confidential information with integrity and sound judgment.
* Stay informed of industry developments and contribute ideas for potential projects or partnerships.
* Conduct research on writers, directors, actors, and other creatives, with a strong focus on identifying emerging talent and trends in television.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* A minimum of 2 years experience assisting an entertainment executive with excellent organization skills, acute attention to detail, ability to balance multiple tasks in a fast\-paced and time sensitive environment
* Consistent record of meeting deadlines and taking initiative to make decisions quickly and under pressure
* Experience calendaring for busy executives
* Demonstrates a proactive ability to anticipate needs and react efficiently and calmly in the face of changes
* Direct experience dealing with sensitive and confidential information with integrity
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills knowing when to delegate issues upward
* Resolved, results\-oriented and excited to tackle challenges while remaining calm under pressure
* We need you to be confident in making decisions on your own when needed and articulate your reasoning
* Overall ability to understand and retain new information quickly with a passion for learning new things, continuous improvement and sharing best practices
* Ability to establish and maintain effective business partnerships
* Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience


**Pay \& Benefits**
 At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $34\.62 and $52\.16/hr, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
   

  

 Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.
   

  

 Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
   

  

 Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.
   

  

 Apple accepts applications to this posting on an ongoing basis.

title: Talent Executive Assistant, CNN
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***








**Who We Are…**





 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
 









 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
 








 We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.
 








 To see what it’s like to work at CNN, follow @WBDLife on 
 
 Instagram
 
  and 
 
 X
 
 !
 




  


**Your New Role…** 




 CNN is seeking a Talent Executive Assistant to partner with one of its most high\-profile and in\-demand correspondents. The ideal candidate is organized, proactive and trustworthy. They will act as a delegate for the talent, both inside and outside the company. They need to perform well under pressure and always represent the team in a professional manner. While most work is expected to take place during weekday working hours, this candidate should expect to be on\-call, reachable and able to engage at night and on weekends as needed.
 



  


**Your Role Accountabilities…** 



* Support all non\-editorial needs of the talent, including – but not limited to – maintaining their calendar, arranging travel and reconciling expense reports
* Collaborate with CNN executives, producers and PR to schedule shoots, promotional opportunities and other professional commitments
* Maintain a “30,000\-foot view” of the talent’s extensive priorities and shifting responsibilities; work to ensure their schedule is as productive and efficient as possible
* Screen and, when appropriate, answer phone calls and emails sent to the talent
* Other duties as assigned



  


**Qualifications \& Experience…** 



* 3\+ years’ of administrative assistant experience preferred. Experience in media, news, digital, and/or entertainment industry preferred.
* To thrive in this role, you should be meticulously organized, detail\-oriented and able to self\-start, prioritize and multitask
* You need to have good business judgment and maintain confidentiality, as well as your composure, under pressure
* Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills will ensure your success
* A bachelor’s degree or commensurate experience, as well as five years’ experience working with talent and/or senior management, are preferred
* Proficient with Microsoft Office and Apple/iOS products, Slack and Zoom















  


**How We Get Things Done…**









 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at
 

















 www.wbd.com/guiding\-principles/
 

















 along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
 








**Championing Inclusion at WBD**



 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
 









 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our
 
 accessibility page
 
 for instructions to submit your request.
